title: The 50% misfire: How Trump made Russian oil cheaper for India - And Putin a winner
description: President Trump's tariff hike on Indian goods, intended to curb Russian oil purchases, backfired. Russia lowered prices, enticing India to resume buying, while China increased its intake of Russian crude. Consequently, Russian oil is more entrenched in Asia, strengthening black market networks and driving India, Russia, and China closer together, undermining the intended pressure on Moscow.

description: Google introduced a new feature called 'Preferred sources' on August 12, 2025, initially in India and the US (English). This allows users to select trusted news outlets, like Times of India, to see more of their coverage in Top stories and a 'From your sources' section.

description: Kawhi Leonard, who joined the Clippers in 2019, is now linked to a fraudulent tree-planting company, Aspiration, allegedly funded by Steve Ballmer. Leonard reportedly signed a $28 million "no-show job" endorsement deal with Aspiration through KL2 Aspire LLC. The Clippers deny circumventing the salary cap, while Aspiration is under U.S. government investigation.

description: A Beijing parade featuring Xi Jinping alongside Putin and Kim Jong Un has sparked EU criticism, with concerns raised about a challenge to the Western-led global order. The event, marking the end of World War II, showcased China's military might and growing ambitions. Trump accused the leaders of conspiring against the US, while the Kremlin dismissed the claims.

The LAPD investigation is likely to be taken over by California state authorities. Syko Stu is now recovering from severe injuries, including head trauma and jaw fractures.

Bronco or Yo-Yo: Fitness takes centre stage in Indian cricket, but is it sustainable?
description: The associations earlier followed a mark of 16.5 as cut-off for yo-yo but showed leniency by selecting even those who posted 14 as, unlike the Virat Kohli-Ravi Shastri era, there was no strict directive from the Indian cricket board. Compared to the world standards, India's Yo-Yo marker wasn't stiff but even then plenty of superstars found it difficult to pass the assessment between what became the dreaded cones in Indian cricket.

Wadephul stressed the Western nations' desire for peace in Ukraine, noting Russia's unwillingness to negotiate despite efforts.

title: Rain batters north India: Scores dead; roads flooded, schools shut
description: North India is facing severe hardship due to continuous rains. Rivers are overflowing, disrupting travel and forcing school closures. The India Meteorological Department issued red alerts for several regions. Punjab is experiencing its worst floods since 1988. Himachal Pradesh declared itself a disaster-affected state. Rescue operations are underway in Jammu and Kashmir.

CBSE–NCB tie-up: 100 schools to pilot drug-free drive; 500+ teachers trained
description: CBSE and NCB have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to combat substance abuse in schools and promote a drug-free environment. The MoU outlines collaborative efforts such as awareness programmes, teacher training, counselling, and digital resources. A pilot programme will begin in 100 CBSE schools. Senior officials attended the event, followed by an awareness session for over 500 educators. This initiative aims to create a safe and supportive ecosystem for students across CBSE-affiliated schools in India.

Putin praised North Korean soldiers' bravery, claiming they fought alongside Russian troops. Kim highlighted strengthened ties since last year's strategic partnership pact, considering support for Russia a "fraternal duty."

GST meet: What will become cheaper after rate cuts? Top things to expect
description: The 56th GST Council meeting, presided over by Nirmala Sitharaman, is set to introduce significant changes to India's indirect taxation framework. The council is considering consolidating GST rates, potentially eliminating the 12% and 28% categories, and shifting items to 5% or 18% brackets.

title: 'Stay without passport': Big relief for minority migrants from these 3 nations
Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; staff must report personal usage
description: Amazon is now requiring employees to meticulously report the percentage of work-related usage on their company phones. This is to adjust their $50 monthly reimbursements proportionally, based on personal use. This phone monitoring is part of broader cost-cutting measures under CEO Andy Jassy's "hardcore culture reset," leading to employee frustration and anxiety about job security.

title: Swift’s past interview has fans saying she manifested Kelce
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's engagement has fans revisiting a 2012 interview where Swift detailed her vision of love and marriage. Her past words about prioritizing mutual dreams and open communication resonate deeply with her current relationship. Fans are celebrating how her teenage ideals seem to be aligning with her real-life romance with the Kansas City Chiefs star.

title: Gabrielle Union stuns in white dress on anniversary getaway
description: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union-Wade celebrated their 11th wedding anniversary, sharing glimpses of their beach vacation on social media. Union reposted a photo of herself in front of a vibrant graffiti wall from Wade's Instagram post. The couple, despite initial skepticism from Wade's family due to their age gap, now enjoy a strong bond and family acceptance.

title: Justin Jefferson, Suni Lee spotted at Minnesota State Fair
description: The Minnesota State Fair became a celebrity hotspot when Vikings' Justin Jefferson and Olympic gymnast Sunisa Lee were spotted together, igniting social media. Lee shared a photo on Instagram, quickly turning the internet into a commentary section, with fans dubbing them "Minnesota royalty." This surprise crossover highlighted the pride and excitement surrounding these two homegrown stars.

title: Youngest woman billionaire on leaving college; parents reaction; money lessons
description: Lucy Guo, the youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her success to her frugal upbringing and early entrepreneurial spirit. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship and founded successful ventures like Scale AI and Passes.
